National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA): – The U.S. government agency that operates the nation’s space program

National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST): – A U.S. government agency that develops and promotes measurements, standards, and technologies to enhance productivity, facilitate trade and improve the quality of life

title: National Science Foundation (NSF): – An independent US government agency responsible for promoting science and engineering

title: Wireless local area network (WLAN): – A local area network that uses a radio technology, such as 80211.x, to interconnect nodes. Wireline: – Telephone service provided by wire or cable, as opposed to mobile phone service. WLAN: – See Wireless Local Area Network

ZigBee: – A standards-based wireless networking technology that supports low data rates, low power consumption, security, and reliability. ZigBee is designed to address the unique needs of most remote monitoring network applications
